label: Behavior 90502197
summary: Vessel behavior pattern: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial:
description: Speed profile: stable (the vessel maintains a consistent speed between 12.8 and 13.2 knots with minimal variation)
Course change: gradual and consistent (COG changes slowly from ~239.6° to ~240.2°, indicating a smooth, intentional course adjustment over time)
Heading fluctuation: stable (heading remains within a narrow range of 236.0°–238.0°, showing controlled directional stability)

Behavior intent: following a curved maritime route (the persistent small differences between COG and heading, combined with stable speed and gradual course evolution, suggest the vessel is navigating a predefined curved channel or coastal bend; position progression follows an approximately linear trajectory in geographic coordinates with slight northeasterly curvature, modeled by a second-order polynomial:
